item.title: Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1 Battle Pass Leaks Reveal Back to the Future Collab
item.content:encoded:
Leaks continue to flood in for Chapter 7 in Fortnite following a creator preview event held by Epic Games, including some of the items set to be included in the Season 1 Battle Pass.

Chapter 6 in Fortnite draws to a close next week with a big Zero Hour live event, and, following a period of downtime, Chapter 7 kicks off on November 30—and there’s a big collab in store, according to leaks.

Leaks Say Marty McFly Skin Coming to Fortnite Chapter 7

According to reliable leakers, including ShiinaBR, Marty McFly from the Back to the Future franchise will feature in the Battle Pass for Chapter 7, Season 1, alongside another big collab that Epic Games has already teased.

McFly’s look will be based on the original Back to the Future films, with high-top trainers, sunglasses, and an orange gilet, and his inclusion comes alongside previous links that indicated the iconic DeLorean car will be featured—with the vehicle already appearing in Epic Games’ Rocket League.

Ahead of the new chapter, Epic Games revealed a collab with Kill Bill, with The Bride shown in a trailer for the upcoming live event, and it’s stated that the iconic look, with the yellow tracksuit, will also feature in the Battle Pass.

The two collabs indicate the widespread rumor that Hollywood serves as major inspiration for the Island in Chapter 7, with a ‘Battlewood’ sign on the hills mimicking the famous Hollywood sign already spotted.

This also aligns with previous leaks for Chapter 7, which indicate that both Harry Potter and SpongeBob Squarepants will have collabs during the Chapter.

What collabs do you want to see in Chapter 7 in Fortnite? Share your ideas in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, check out the leaks of driveable reboot vans and a bot mode, and take a look at all the quests and rewards in the Party Up – Winter Rush event.

item.title: ARC Raiders November 20 Update & Full 1.3.0 Patch Notes—Venator Nerfed & Rubber Duck Feature Added
item.content:encoded:
Embark Studios is well aware that ARC Raiders is a success. This is why the developer keeps supporting the game with new updates and dropping patch notes like it’s hot. The November 20 ARC Raiders 1.3.0 update drops some big changes that you can’t DUCK.

ARC Raiders is amazing, but it isn’t perfect. This is why Embark Studios nerfed ARC Raiders’ most OP perk not long ago. The changes will keep coming, and improvements will shape ARC into the extraction shooter.

We’ve got everything you need to know about the ARC Raiders 1.3.0 update, featuring full patch notes at the end.

Biggest ARC Raiders November 20 Changes

Various balance changes have rolled out for the value of certain items, specific damage numbers—such as the Venator—have been readjusted, many bugs have been fixed, and there’s even a nice touch for rubber duck fans.

You will need to think twice when selling certain items in ARC Raiders—such as Power Cells and certain ammo—as Embark has rung the changes. ARCs have been weakened to behave slightly more reasonably, and the Venator’s fire rate has been reworked, as it was “over-performing.”

One of the biggest, growing pastimes in ARC Raiders is collecting rubber ducks. While Embark hasn’t stated specifically what the change is, the dev has been listening to your request:

“Your Raider Den has been ducked out.”

All ARC Raiders Patch Notes For November 20 Update 1.3.0

Here’s the complete 1.3.0 patch notes for you to read.

Balance Changes

Items:

Deadline

  • Buy value: From 8,100 to 15,000 Coins
  • Sell value: From 3,000 to 5,000 Coins
  • Crafting:
    • Old: 2 Explosive compound + 1 Synthesized fuel
    • New: 3 Explosive compound + 2 ARC Circuitry 
  • Deadline trader stock: From 3 to 1

Power cell

  • Sell value: From 640 to 270 Coins

Launcher ammo

  • Buy value:
    • Old: 10 launcher ammo for 6,000 Coins
    • New: 6 launcher ammo for 4,500 Coins
  • Sell value: From 200 to 250
  • Crafting:
    • Old: 6 launcher ammo for 4 Metal parts + 1 Explosive Compound
    • New: 6 launcher ammo for 1 ARC Motion Core + 2 Crude Explosives
  • Launcher ammo crafting is available at the Workbench without needing a blueprint.

Venator

Dev note: The fully upgraded Venator has been over-performing recently, capable of outgunning full squads using close range weapons. We’re re-tuning the fire-rate gained from upgrades to pull down the pacing a bit, while still keeping its damage and accuracy intact. This should encourage players to take some more time with their shots rather than mag-dumping the first poor soul they encounter. The community also rightfully pointed out that the weight of the Venator was inconsistent with the weights of our other pistols, so we’ve corrected that as well.

  • Reduced Fire-rate gained from upgrades from 22/44/60% to 13/26/40%.
  • Increased Weight from 2 to 5.

Explosive Damage

Dev note: We noticed that explosives dealt damage to more parts at once than intended, allowing weapons like the Hullcracker to kill larger drones too quickly. We’ve adjusted explosive damage to make it more consistent across the board, and we’ve re-balanced the damage of the Hullcracker to account for that change. This will require Hullcracker shots to need a bit more precision while still dealing good damage to the targeted spot.

  • Rebalanced explosive damage against ARC for a more consistent experience.
  • Explosions on smaller enemies, e.g. Turrets are largely unaffected.
  • Explosions on larger sized enemies, e.g. Bastion will typically deal a bit less damage.

Content and Bug Fixes

ARC

  • Fixed a bug where ARC could call down reinforcements outside the map.
  • Shredder
    • Shredder will now detect and move more reliably towards Lure Grenades.
    • Shredder movement and handling updated: slightly reduced turn speed, improved braking, stiffer suspension, and more consistent reactions to impacts for steadier behavior in combat.
    • Improved Shredder navigation to prevent it from getting stuck on corners when moving toward the player.

Audio 

  • Reduced volume attenuation for explosion tinnitus and concussion effects to improve clarity.

Maps 

  • Barricades can no longer be placed overlapping your character, preventing clipping through walls and access to locked rooms.
  • The Dam Battlegrounds
    • Fixed an issue where players would get stuck in the Dam Control Tower elevator shaft.
  • Spaceport
    • Added collision to the staircase walls and ceiling in the Hidden Bunker on Spaceport.
    • Fixed an issue where players could enter the wall near the Launch Tower ramp on Spaceport, preventing unfair ambushes.
    • Fixed an issue where players could access the locked room on the Control Tower without a key.
  • Blue Gate
    • Fixed railing props on Blue Gate that mistakenly blocked bullets; shots now pass through as expected.
  • Stella Montis
    • Fixed a collision issue on Stella Montis near the Train Station that could cause players to fall through the terrain.
    • Fixed a location in Stella Montis Train Station where players could get stuck.
    • Removed two player spawns on Stella Montis that were too close to ARC spawn areas.
    • Fixed missing visibility collision on walls in the Business Center area of Stella Montis that allowed shots to pass through.

Miscellaneous

  • Fixed a crash when using Raider Voice (proximity chat) on PCs without AVX2 support.
  • Fixed a crash that could occur when surrendering after reconnecting to a session.
  • Fixed an issue where scavenging parts from the Shredder could leave behind invisible collisions.
  • Fixed an issue where the Trials weekly rollover could display an outdated rank; the celebration now reflects the correct current rank and the UI remains accurate during the cooldown period.
  • Updated recommended AMD graphics driver to version 25.11.1 to reduce recent crash issues on AMD GPUs.
  • Your Raider Den has been ducked out.

Movement 

  • Improved enemy ground detection to better handle steep surfaces, reducing erratic movement when traversing angled terrain.

Weapons 

  • Aphelion
    • Fixed an issue where Aphelion tracers could become excessively bright at distance, reducing visibility for the player being shot at.
    • Increased Aphelion blueprint drop rates.
  • Stitcher
    • Corrected player facing stats for the Stitcher, showing incorrect scaling of reload time across upgrade levels.

Big thanks to the official ARC Raiders page for the complete 1.3.0 patch notes.

Have any of these fixes or changes caught your eye? What do you think Embark needs to focus on for the next update? The Insider Gaming Discord Server is where you can share your ideas.

Check out the news that ARC Raiders’ New Map Has Been Visited Over 25 Million Times and Friendly Fire Taking Down Queen in the Most Hilarious Way

item.title: Fortnite Chapter 7 Leaks Reveal Driveable Reboot Vans & Bots Mode
item.content:encoded:
Major Fortnite leaks for Chapter 7 content have begun to flood social media following a creator preview event in Los Angeles, with standout details including driveable reboot vans and a dedicated bots mode.

Epic Games is gearing up for the major Zero Hour end-of-chapter event next week, which will be followed by the start of Chapter 7, Season 1, and big changes are on the cards that will impact various core mechanics of the game.

Driveable Reboot Vans, Bots Mode & Storm Size Changes Coming

According to reliable leakers, including ShiinaBR, some of the biggest gameplay changes coming to Fortnite in Chapter 7 include reboot vans being driveable, an overhaul to the gameplay UI, and a dedicated Solo vs Bots mode.

Bots are nothing new in Fortnite and are widely used to populate Battle Royale lobbies to reduce wait time, but introducing a dedicated mode where solo players go head-to-head with them is a big change. However, there is still plenty to be detailed about the game mode.

Driveable reboot vans align with previous hints towards a revamp of the reboot system in Fortnite, which will result in changes to gameplay tactically as reboot vans will be moveable, thus becoming a core resource later in games to revive fallen teammates, or prevent opponents from bringing back their squad.

Another big change, again leaked by ShiinaBR, shows that storm sizes are being adjusted in Chapter 7 away from the standard circle closing in, instead having a ‘seven’ shape. However, it’s mentioned that the sizes and timings are not final.

Epic Games will reveal all the major changes to Fortnite in Chapter 7 closer to the release date, likely sharing the full details in a pre-launch blog ahead of the start of the new chapter on December 30.

What feature should Fortnite look to change in Chapter 7? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, check out all the quests and rewards in the Party Up – Winter Rush event, and read about the addition of Unity games in 2026.

item.title: When is Fortnite Chapter 7, Season 1? Release Date & Expected Start Time
item.content:encoded:
Another year in Fortnite is drawing to a close, and a new chapter is on the horizon. Insider Gaming has all the details about when Chapter 7, Season 1 kicks off in the game.

The past year in Fortnite has been full of huge collabs, including the likes of The Simpsons, Star Wars, Godzilla, and Power Rangers, and Chapter 7 is likely to follow in a similar trend with other huge crossovers.

For all the details about the launch of Fortnite Chapter 7, Season 1, take a look at the guide below.

What is The Fortnite Chapter 7, Season 1 Release Date?

Chapter 7, Season 1 in Fortnite is due to kick off on Sunday, November 30, as confirmed by Epic Games themselves.

Epic Games has begun to tease the new chapter, including a big collab with Quentin Tarantino’s Kill Bill, which is set to be one of the first major collabs of Chapter 7 in Fortnite.

The tease confirmed the release date for Fortnite Chapter 7, which comes the day after the big Zero Hour live event, bringing an end to Chapter 6, which is expected to be followed by downtime soon in the early hours of the morning on November 30 ahead of the season launch.

Do We Know The Fortnite Chapter 7, Season 1 Start Time?

No official start time for Fortnite Chapter 7, Season 1 has been announced by Epic Games, nor is it expected that a precise time will be shared due to the maintenance length, but history provides an idea of how long downtime will be.

Fortnite’s Zero Hour live event takes place at 2 PM ET on November 29, and server downtime is expected to follow soon after. While it’s unlikely to be immediate, downtime should take place at the usual start time of around 2 AM ET on November 30, and they will be out of action for a while.

In 2024, downtime before the launch of Chapter 6 was seven hours, but a year earlier, the Big Bang event was followed by 11 hours of downtime—with the longer spell likely due to the variety of new modes that were launched, including LEGO Fortnite and Fortnite Festival.

In 2022, end-of-chapter downtime was 9 hours, while 2021 downtime was a staggering 18 hours. However, nothing compares to The End event in October 2019, which was followed by 36 hours of downtime.

Based on this, don’t expect Fortnite Chapter 7, Season 1 to be live until 9 AM ET at the very earliest, and the wait could be many hours longer. As usual, social media is the best place to keep track.

What are your expectations for Fortnite during Chapter 7? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, check out all the quests and rewards during the Party Up – Winter Rush event, and take a look at the news that Unity games will be available in Fortnite in 2026.
